metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15664 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
By holding a reference to the eval() function from an about:blank window, amalicious webpage could have gained access to the InstallTrigger objectwhich would allow them to prompt the user to install an extension. Combinedwith user confusion, this could result in an unintended or maliciousextension being installed. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80,Thunderbird < 78.2, Thunderbird < 68.12, Firefox ESR < 68.12, Firefox ESR <78.2, and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15664` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
